qas.question: Feynman used this to protect his eyes during the test detonation
What atomic bomb test did Feynman see?

plausible_answers.text: because of the immense brightness of the explosion

qas.question: Why did Feynman decide never to have a truck?

context: He immersed himself in work on the project, and was present at the <a1_0><b4_0>Trinity bomb test<b4_0/><a1_0/>. Feynman claimed to be the only person to see the explosion without the very dark glasses or welder's lenses provided, reasoning that it was safe to look through a <a0_0>truck windshield<a0_0/>, as it would screen out the harmful <a3_0><b6_0>ultraviolet radiation<b6_0/><a3_0/>. On witnessing the blast, Feynman ducked towards the floor of his truck <b7_0>because of the immense brightness of the explosion<b7_0/>, where he saw a temporary <a2_0><b5_0>"purple splotch" afterimage<b5_0/><a2_0/> of the event.
